17.post_text: Start from the outside and go ahead personalizing every small detail of your #FerrariPortofino: http://bit.ly/FerrariPortofino_CarConfigurator

comments.message:
This is the car I would most like to own and drive. 
Of course, I LOVE all of the Extreme Performance of the entire line-up of Ferrari's... But I have some physical limitations from a severe crash years ago, that have declined in recent years to a point where I could not comfortably get in and out of the top performance cars. 
I am looking for "Driving Pleasure" more than the Fastest Lap time. And I have always enjoyed Summer Days riding briskly down open country roads in an open vehicle or my motorcycle!
{ Now, if only we could wedge the 812 Superfast engine and the Lusso AWD under the skin of this gorgeous car...I would truly be in HEAVEN!} <3 :D

22.post_text: #Ferrari 212 Export Coupé Vignale: a classic expression of excellence. #Maranello

comments.message: Like a toy.... Like a pearl.... With a blond it will be fine

It isn’ t one anymore... coupè ! The car has a very particular history . Built in April of 1951 and equipped with a V12 by 60° engine , it was sold later in May to Anthony Mambretti Sozogni Juva and one month it was surrendered to the firm of the Duke Cesare of Acquarone . It was really the Duke of Acquarone , at the end of 1951, to want the radical change of body .  The car , cover originally , was transformed in spider , ( “ barchetta “ ) , from Vignale and in 1957 it was surrendered to an impassioned of Padua : his son , the revenges to a brazilian collector   . In the last years the 212 Export has participated more times to the historical  “ Mille Miglia “.  The auto has suffered a job of complete restauration , it has entirely been gotten off and restored as after the intervention of the end of 1951 , and it is ready to return in the hands of the owner now . The restitution however it won' t happen before April . The customer has in fact consented to that 212 is exposed to the Museum of Maranello for some months .
When Ferrari was still true to it's roots.
